com.mumfrey.liteloader.api

Interface EnumerationObserver

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Observer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ModEvents

    public interface EnumerationObserver
extends Observer
    LiteLoader Extensible API - Enumeration observer EnumerationObserver receive callbacks when mod containers are enumerated. Instances of this class must be returned from getPreInitObservers in order to work.
    Author:
    Adam Mummery-Smith

        void onRegisterTweakContainer(LoaderEnumerator enumerator,
                              TweakContainer<java.io.File> container)
        Called AFTER registration of an ENABLED container (eg. onRegisterEnabledContainer will be called first) if that container also contains tweaks.
        Parameters:

        container -

      • onModAdded

        void onModAdded(LoaderEnumerator enumerator,
                ModInfo<LoadableMod<?>> mod)
        Called when a mod container is added to the pending mods list. This does not mean that the specific mod will actually be instanced since the mod can still be disabled via the exclusion list (this is to allow entire containers to be disabled or just individual mods) and so if you wish to observe actual mod instantiation you should still provide a ResourceObserver. However this event expresses a declaration by the enumerator of an intention to load the specified mod.
        Parameters:
        enumerator -
        mod -
